item.title: The Wasm-Host data transfer: basics
item.description: Overview # 1. Two worlds # The data transferring occur between two worlds: the native world and the Wasm world. The native world refers to the memory space that the host program can legally access, and the Wasm world refers to the memory space that the Wasm program can legally access. The native world contains the Wasm world, so the host program can access both two worlds, but the Wasm program can access the Wasm world only.
